lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Represents a duke.command to add a deadline task to the task list.
* The {@code AddDeadlineCommand} class encapsulates the details of the deadline,
* including its description and due date. When executed, the deadline is added
* to the task list and the list is saved using the provided storage.
* Due date of the deadline task.
* Constructs a new {@code AddDeadlineCommand} with the provided description
* @param description description of the deadline task.
* @param by due date of the deadline task.
* Executes the duke.command by adding a new deadline to the provided task list,
* and saving the updated list using the provided storage.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Indicates that this duke.command doesn't terminate the application.
* @return {@code false} since this duke.command doesn't cause the application to exit.
* Represents a duke.command to add an event task to the task list.
* The {@code AddEventCommand} class encapsulates the details of the event,
* including its description and the duration it spans (from-to). When executed,
* the event is added to the task list and the list is saved using the provided storage.
* Constructs a new {@code AddEventCommand} with the provided description
* @param description description of the event task.
* @param from starting time/date of the event.
* @param to ending time/date of the event.
public AddEventCommand(String description, String from, String to) {
* Executes the duke.command by adding a new event to the provided task list,
* and saving the updated list using the provided storage.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Indicates that this duke.command doesn't terminate the application.
* @return {@code false} since this duke.command doesn't cause the application to exit.
* Represents a duke.command to add a to-do task to the task list.
* The {@code AddTodoCommand} class encapsulates the details of the to-do,
* specifically its description. When executed, the to-do is added to the
* task list and the list is saved using the provided storage.
* Constructs a new {@code AddTodoCommand} with the provided description.
* @param description Description of the to-do task.
* Executes the duke.command by adding a new to-do to the provided task list,
* and saving the updated list using the provided storage.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Indicates that this duke.command doesn't terminate the application.
* @return {@code false} since this duke.command doesn't cause the application to exit.
* Represents an abstract duke.command that can be executed in the application.
* Executes the specific duke.command using the provided task list, user interface, and storage system.
* @throws Exception If there's any error during the duke.command execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws Exception;
* Checks if this duke.command triggers an exit from the application.
* @return {@code true} if the duke.command causes the application to exit, otherwise {@code false}.
* Represents a duke.command to delete a specific task from the task list.
* This duke.command deletes a task identified by its index from the provided task list.
* Once deleted, it also saves the updated list to storage.
/** The index of the task to be deleted. */
* Constructs a new DeleteCommand with the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task in the task list to be deleted.
* Deletes the task from the task list based on its index and saves the updated list to storage.
* @throws InvalidIndexException If the provided index is not valid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws InvalidIndexException {
* Specifies that executing a DeleteCommand will not cause the application to exit.
* @return {@code false} as deleting a task doesn't terminate the application.
* Represents a duke.command to exit the application.
* When executed, this duke.command displays an exit message to the user and indicates to the application
* Executes the exit duke.command, displaying an exit message to the user.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Specifies that executing an ExitCommand will cause the application to exit.
* @return {@code true} indicating the application should terminate.
* Represents a duke.command to list all duke.tasks in the application.
* When executed, this duke.command will display all duke.tasks in the task list to the user.
* Executes the list duke.command, displaying all duke.tasks in the task list to the user.
* @param tasks List of duke.tasks to be displayed.
* @param storage Storage system (not used in this duke.command but retained for consistency).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Specifies that executing a ListCommand will not cause the application to exit.
* @return {@code false} indicating the application should continue running.
* Represents a duke.command to mark a task as completed.
* When executed, this duke.command will mark the task at the specified index as completed.
/** The index of the task to be marked as completed. */
* Constructs a new MarkCommand with the specified index.
* @param index Index of the task to be marked as completed.
* Executes the mark duke.command, marking the task at the specified index as completed.
* @throws InvalidIndexException If the given index is out of bounds.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws InvalidIndexException {
* Specifies that executing a MarkCommand will not cause the application to exit.
* @return {@code false} indicating the application should continue running.
* Represents a duke.command to unmark a task as completed.
* When executed, this duke.command will unmark the task at the specified index as completed.
/** The index of the task to be unmarked as completed. */
* Constructs a new UnmarkCommand with the specified index.
* @param index Index of the task to be unmarked as completed.
* Executes the unmark duke.command, unmarking the task at the specified index as completed.
* @throws InvalidIndexException If the given index is out of bounds.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws InvalidIndexException {
* Specifies that executing an UnmarkCommand will not cause the application to exit.
* @return {@code false} indicating the application should continue running.
* Represents an duke.exception that is thrown when the application encounters corrupted or incorrectly formatted data.
* This duke.exception indicates that the data read from the storage or hard drive is not in the expected format.
* Constructs a new CorruptHarddriveException with a default error message.
super(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but the data is not in the correct format :-(");
* Exception thrown when an unrecognized duke.util.duke.command is provided to the duke.Duke chatbot.
* Constructs a duke.exception.DukeException with a default error message.
super(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Exception thrown when a task's field (description, by, from, to) is found to be empty.
* Constructs an duke.exception.EmptyTaskException with a specific error message based on the type of task and the empty field.
* @param type  The type of task (e.g., todo, deadline, event).
* @param field The specific field (e.g., description, by, from, to) that is empty.
super(" OOPS!!! The " + field + " of a " + type + " cannot be empty.");
* Represents an duke.exception that is thrown when the application encounters an invalid date and time input.
* This duke.exception is triggered when the user provides a date and time format that does not match the expected formats:
* Constructs a new InvalidDateTimeException with a default error message.
super(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but the input of date and time is invalid. Please follow the format of yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-dd HHmm :-(");
* Exception thrown when an invalid index is used to access a list.
* Constructs an duke.exception.InvalidIndexException with a default error message.
super(" OOPS!!! This index is out of the list's bounds.");
* Represents a task with a specific deadline.

*

A Deadline task is an extension of the basic Task, with an added
* characteristic of a "by" field that represents the deadline of the task.
* Creates a new deadline task with the specified description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by          The deadline of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task.
* @return A formatted string showing the deadline task's type, status, description, and deadline.
* Returns a transformed format of the deadline task, useful for data storage or other operations.
* @return A string that represents the deadline task in a unique format.
* Represents a task that occurs during a specific period.

*

An Event task is an extension of the basic Task, with additional characteristics of
* "from" and "to" fields representing the start and end times of the event, respectively.
* Creates a new event task with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param from        The start time of the event.
* @param to          The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a string representation of the event task.
* @return A formatted string showing the event task's type, status, description, start time, and end time.
* Returns a transformed format of the event task, useful for data storage or other operations.
* @return A string that represents the event task in a unique format.
* Represents a generic task with a specific type, description, and completion status.

*

The Task class is a fundamental representation of a task that can be of various types such as TODO, DEADLINE, or EVENT.
* Each task has a type, a description, and a flag that indicates whether it has been completed.
* Constructs a new Task instance with the specified type and description.
* @param type        The type of the task, which can be one of the values in {@link TaskType}.
* @param description A brief description of the task.
this.done = false; // Default value for a new task
* Provides a string representation of the task, which includes its type, completion status, and description.
* @return A formatted string indicating the task's type, whether it's done, and its description.
* Sets the task's completion status to 'done'.
* Resets the task's completion status to 'not done'.
* Transforms the task's data into a specific format, useful for data storage or other representations.
* @return A formatted string that represents the task's type, completion status, and description in a unique format.
* Represents a list of duke.tasks, allowing for various operations such as
* adding, deleting, marking duke.tasks as done, and unmarking duke.tasks.

*

The TaskList class provides a comprehensive set of methods to manage and manipulate
* a list of duke.tasks. Each task in the list can be accessed by its index.
* Methods throw {@link InvalidIndexException} if operations are attempted on invalid indices.
* Initializes an empty list of duke.tasks.
* Initializes a task list with a given list of duke.tasks.
* @param tasks An ArrayList of duke.tasks to be added to the task list.
* Adds a task to the list and prints a confirmation message.
* @param task The task to be added to the list.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + store.size() + " duke.tasks in the list.");

* @throws InvalidIndexException If the provided index is out of bounds.
public void deleteTask(int index) throws InvalidIndexException {
System.out.println("Now you have " + store.size() + " duke.tasks in the list.");
* Prints all the duke.tasks currently in the list.
System.out.println("Here are the duke.tasks in your list:");

* @param index The index of the task to be marked as done.
* @throws InvalidIndexException If the provided index is out of bounds.
public void markTask(int index) throws InvalidIndexException {
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Marks a task as not done based on its index and prints a confirmation message.

public void unmarkTask(int index) throws InvalidIndexException {

* Retrieves the current list of duke.tasks.

* Creates a new todo task with the specified description.

* Utility class for parsing and transforming date-time strings.
* The DateParser class provides functionality for transforming date and datetime strings from
* one format to another. The class currently supports date strings in the format "yyyy-MM-dd"
* and datetime strings in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm".
* Formatter for parsing input date strings in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* Formatter for parsing input datetime strings in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm".
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_DATETIME_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");
* Formatter for producing output date strings in the format "MMM dd yyyy".
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_DATE_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy");
* Formatter for producing output datetime strings in the format "MMM dd yyyy, h:mma".
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_DATETIME_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, h:mma");
* Pattern for validating input datetime strings.
private static final Pattern DATETIME_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("^\\d{4}-\\d{2}-\\d{2} \\d{4}$");
* Pattern for validating input date strings.
* Transforms the input date or datetime string to a different format.
* If the input string matches the datetime pattern "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm", it will be transformed to
* "MMM dd yyyy, h:mma". If the input string matches the date pattern "yyyy-MM-dd", it will be
* transformed to "MMM dd yyyy". If the input string doesn't match any of the known patterns,
* @param dateTimeStr the input date or datetime string.
* @return a transformed date or datetime string.
* @throws InvalidDateTimeException if the input string format is invalid.
public static String transformDateTimeFormat(String dateTimeStr) throws InvalidDateTimeException {
* Initializes a new Pair with the specified key and value.
* @param key   The key for this pair.
* @param value The value to be paired with the specified key.
* Retrieves the key of this pair.
* @return The key associated with this pair.
* Retrieves the value of this pair.
* @return The value associated with this pair.
* Provides functionality to parse user input into commands that the application can understand.
* Parses the input string into a Command.
* @param input The raw input string from the user.
* @return A Command that corresponds to the input instruction.
* @throws DukeException If the input does not match any duke.command or is invalid.
* @throws EmptyTaskException If the input is missing essential information.
* @throws InvalidDateTimeException If the date or time format is invalid.
public static Command parse(String input) throws DukeException, EmptyTaskException, InvalidDateTimeException {
* Parses a string to extract a pair of values.
* @return A Pair where the key is the first word of the input, and the value is the rest of the string.
* @throws DukeException If the input string is empty.
private static Pair parsePair(String input) throws DukeException {
* Converts a string to an integer.
* @return The integer representation of the string.
* @throws DukeException If the string cannot be parsed into an integer.
private static int parseInt(String argument) throws DukeException {
